Interface Transport

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable
All Known Implementing Classes:
UdpTransport
public interface Transport extends AutoCloseable
Abstract transport layer for Neon protocol communication. Allows pluggable transport implementations (UDP, TCP, QUIC, etc.).

The transport is responsible for:

  • Binding to a local address
  • Sending packets to remote addresses
  • Receiving packets from any sender
  • Managing socket options and timeouts
Since:
1.1

  • Method Details

    • getType

      Transport.Type getType()
      Returns the transport type.
      Returns:
      the transport type

    • bind

      void bind(int port) throws IOException
      Binds the transport to the specified port. Use port 0 to bind to any available port.
      Parameters:
      port - the port to bind to
      Throws:
      IOException - if binding fails

    • getLocalAddress

      SocketAddress getLocalAddress()
      Returns the local address this transport is bound to.
      Returns:
      the local socket address

    • send

      void send(byte[] data, SocketAddress address) throws IOException
      Sends raw bytes to the specified address.
      Parameters:
      data - the data to send
      address - the destination address
      Throws:
      IOException - if sending fails

    • sendPacket

      default void sendPacket(NeonPacket packet, SocketAddress address) throws IOException
      Sends a Neon packet to the specified address.
      Parameters:
      packet - the packet to send
      address - the destination address
      Throws:
      IOException - if sending fails

    • receive

      Transport.ReceivedData receive() throws IOException
      Receives a packet from the transport. Returns null if no packet is available (non-blocking) or throws on timeout.
      Returns:
      the received packet or null
      Throws:
      IOException - if receiving fails

    • setBlocking

      void setBlocking(boolean blocking) throws IOException
      Sets blocking mode for the transport.
      Parameters:
      blocking - true for blocking mode
      Throws:
      IOException - if setting fails

    • isBlocking

      boolean isBlocking()
      Checks if the transport is in blocking mode.
      Returns:
      true if blocking

    • setTimeout

      void setTimeout(int timeoutMs) throws IOException
      Sets the receive timeout in milliseconds. Set to 0 for infinite timeout.
      Parameters:
      timeoutMs - the timeout in milliseconds
      Throws:
      IOException - if setting fails

    • isClosed

      boolean isClosed()
      Checks if the transport is closed.
      Returns:
      true if closed
